message: So, I am looking to buy some new computer parts for an upgrade (GPU, CPU and a RAM), would it be better to get them from a local store in Egypt or order them from Amazon or other vendors abroad and have them shipped?

data.message:
depends on the quality you seek :D
If you want fancy Corsair RAMs and Samsung SSDs, then they will probably be overpriced here, that is if you found them :D
I paid waaay too much for what's supposed to be a $100 Samsung 850 Evo 250GB SSD :S
Well, I do plan to get Kingston RAMs, nvidia GeForce gtx 750 2GB and a core i7 processor...

Kingston RAMs are everywhere here and they're cheap.
BTW I'm still trying to make the jump and start getting stuff from Amazon instead of doing my usual walk in Soo2 El 3asr (and other tech malls), so I don't know exactly how things look on the other side yet :D

Well, I have never tinkered with hardware before so I am learning as I go about it.

Do you recommend a certain RAM brand or have tips if you please?

عن تجربة شخصية، لو هتجيب حاجة من برة يبقى تخلي حد نازل يحيبها معاه، غير كدة، اخطف رجلك بس نص ساعة شوف صالة الجمارك في مطار القاهرة و شوف الحاجة بتتعامل ازاي و هتحرم تشتري اي حاجة من برة الا لو كانت كورة كاوتش. النقطة التانية، ان الجمارك بالمزاج، و لا نسبة و لا قانون و لا يحزنون، كل مرة هتيجي لك شكل.

في حاجات هنا اسعارها مبالغ فيها بشكل مستفز، خصوصا كروت الشاشة، فعشان كدة بلاش تجيب احدث حاجة، خليك متأخر generation أو اتنين. لو مينفعش، يبقى دور بجدية عن حد نازل يجيب لك الحاجة معاه. غير كدة، الزيادة في السعر مع وجود ضمان افضل بكتير من المخاطرة بإن حاجتك يتمسح بيها الارض في الجمارك و تدفع عليها مبلغ جزافي متعرفش هو كام الا ساعة الدفع.
I heard that the services that ship you things from the US (or buy them for you, or whatever) know how to deal with the gamarek and make sure that things pass through.

I have bought stuff finer than GPU (Adonit stylus precision discs) and they handled them well.

It's risky, but if it can be pulled off, would the price and quality be better?

mainstream PC components(and also higher mid-end) are slightly cheaper in Egypt, you can easily find that by comparing prices on egprices or any similar website and amazon.
And if you add the warranty to that, you're better off with local components.
